options.name: title
options.desciption: Document title

options.name: author
options.desciption: Author or authors of the document

options.name: institute
options.desciption: Author affiliations for the presentation.

options.name: date
options.desciption: Document date

options.name: subtitle
options.desciption: Identifies the subtitle of the document.

options.name: lang
options.desciption:
Identifies the main language of the document using IETF language tags 
(following the [BCP 47](https://www.rfc-editor.org/info/bcp47) standard), 
such as `en` or `en-GB`. The [Language subtag lookup](https://r12a.github.io/app-subtags/) 
tool can look up or verify these tags. 

This affects most formats, and controls hyphenation 
in PDF output when using LaTeX (through [`babel`](https://ctan.org/pkg/babel) 
and [`polyglossia`](https://ctan.org/pkg/polyglossia)) or ConTeXt.

options.name: dir
options.desciption:
The base script direction for the document.

For bidirectional documents, native pandoc `span`s and
`div`s with the `dir` attribute (value `rtl` or `ltr`) can
be used to override the base direction in some output
formats.  This may not always be necessary if the final
renderer (e.g. the browser, when generating HTML) supports
the [Unicode Bidirectional Algorithm].

When using LaTeX for bidirectional documents, only the
`xelatex` engine is fully supported (use
`--pdf-engine=xelatex`).

options.name: keywords
options.desciption: List of keywords to be included in the document metadata.

options.name: description-meta
options.desciption: Sets the description metadata for the document

options.name: author-meta
options.desciption: Sets the author metadata for the document

options.name: date-meta
options.desciption: Sets the date metadata for the document

options.name: theme
options.desciption: Theme name, theme scss file, or a mix of both.

options.name: css
options.desciption: One or more CSS style sheets.

options.name: html-math-method
options.desciption: Method use to render math in HTML output

options.name: section-divs
options.desciption:
Wrap sections in `<section>` tags and attach identifiers to the enclosing `<section>`
rather than the heading itself.

options.name: identifier-prefix
options.desciption:
Specify a prefix to be added to all identifiers and internal links in HTML and
DocBook output, and to footnote numbers in Markdown and Haddock output. 
This is useful for preventing duplicate identifiers when generating fragments
to be included in other pages.

options.name: title-prefix
options.desciption:
Specify STRING as a prefix at the beginning of the title that appears in 
the HTML header (but not in the title as it appears at the beginning of the body)

options.name: email-obfuscation
options.desciption:
Specify a method for obfuscating `mailto:` links in HTML documents.
`none` leaves `mailto:` links as they are.  `javascript` obfuscates
them using JavaScript. `references` obfuscates them by printing their
letters as decimal or hexadecimal character references.  The default
is `none`.

options.name: html-q-tags
options.desciption: Use `<q>` tags for quotes in HTML.

options.name: toc-title
options.desciption: The title used for the table of contents.

options.name: number-sections
options.desciption:
Number section headings rendered ouptut. By default, sections are not numbered.
Sections with class `.unnumbered` will never be numbered, even if `number-sections`
is specified.

options.name: number-depth
options.desciption:
By default, all headings in your document create a 
numbered section. You customize numbering depth using 
the `number-depth` option. 

For example, to only number sections immediately below 
the chapter level, use this:

```yaml  
number-depth: 1
```

options.name: number-offset
options.desciption:
Offset for section headings in output (offsets are 0 by default)
The first number is added to the section number for
top-level headings, the second for second-level headings, and so on.
So, for example, if you want the first top-level heading in your
document to be numbered "6", specify `number-offset: 5`. If your
document starts with a level-2 heading which you want to be numbered
"1.5", specify `number-offset: [1,4]`. Implies `number-sections`

options.name: shift-heading-level-by
options.desciption:
Shift heading levels by a positive or negative integer.
For example, with `shift-heading-level-by: -1`, level 2
headings become level 1 headings, and level 3 headings
become level 2 headings.  Headings cannot have a level
less than 1, so a heading that would be shifted below level 1
becomes a regular paragraph.  Exception: with a shift of -N,
a level-N heading at the beginning of the document
replaces the metadata title.

options.name: incremental
options.desciption:
Make list items in slide shows display incrementally (one by one). 
The default is for lists to be displayed all at once.

options.name: slide-level
options.desciption:
Specifies that headings with the specified level create slides.
Headings above this level in the hierarchy are used to divide 
the slide show into sections; headings below this level create 
subheads within a slide. Valid values are 0-6. If a slide level
of 0 is specified, slides will not be split automatically on 
headings, and horizontal rules must be used to indicate slide 
boundaries. If a slide level is not specified explicitly, the
slide level will be set automatically based on the contents of
the document

options.name: slide-number
options.desciption:
Display the page number of the current slide

- `true`:    Show slide number
- `false`:   Hide slide number

Can optionally be set as a string that specifies the number formatting:

- `h.v`:   Horizontal . vertical slide number
- `h/v`:   Horizontal / vertical slide number
- `c`:   Flattened slide number
- `c/t`:   Flattened slide number / total slides (default)

options.name: show-slide-number
options.desciption: Contexts in which the slide number appears

options.name: title-slide-attributes
options.desciption:
Additional attributes for the title slide of a reveal.js presentation as a map of 
attribute names and values. For example

```yaml
  title-slide-attributes:
      data-background-image: /path/to/title_image.png
      data-background-size: contain      
```

(Note that the data- prefix is required here, as it isnâ€™t added automatically.)

options.name: center-title-slide
options.desciption: Vertical centering of title slide

options.name: show-notes
options.desciption: Make speaker notes visible to all viewers

options.name: rtl
options.desciption: Change the presentation direction to be RTL

options.name: logo
options.desciption: Logo image (placed in bottom right corner of slides)

options.name: footer
options.desciption:
Footer to include on all slides. Can also be set per-slide by including a
div with class `.footer` on the slide.

options.name: scrollable
options.desciption:
Allow content that overflows slides vertically to scroll. This can also
be set per-slide by including the `.scrollable` class on the slide title.

options.name: smaller
options.desciption:
Use a smaller default font for slide content. This can also
be set per-slide by including the `.smaller` class on the slide title.

options.name: overview
options.desciption: Enable the slide overview mode

options.name: transition
options.desciption: Slide transition style

options.name: transition-speed
options.desciption: Slide transition speed

options.name: background-transition
options.desciption: Transition style for full page slide backgrounds

options.name: fragments
options.desciption: Turns fragments on and off globally

options.name: auto-animate
options.desciption: Globally enable/disable auto-animate (enabled by default)

options.name: auto-animate-easing
options.desciption:
Default CSS easing function for auto-animation.
Can be overridden per-slide or per-element via attributes.

options.name: auto-animate-duration
options.desciption:
Duration (in seconds) of auto-animate transition.
Can be overridden per-slide or per-element via attributes.

options.name: auto-animate-unmatched
options.desciption:
Auto-animate unmatched elements.
Can be overridden per-slide or per-element via attributes.

options.name: auto-animate-styles
options.desciption:
CSS properties that can be auto-animated (positional styles like top, left, etc.
are always animated.

options.name: progress
options.desciption: Display a presentation progress bar

options.name: history
options.desciption: Push each slide change to the browser history

options.name: navigation-mode
options.desciption:
Changes the behavior of navigation directions.

`default`:
Left/right arrow keys step between horizontal slides, up/down
arrow keys step between vertical slides. Space key steps through
all slides (both horizontal and vertical).

`linear`:
Removes the up/down arrows. Left/right arrows step through all
slides (both horizontal and vertical).

`grid`:
When this is enabled, stepping left/right from a vertical stack
to an adjacent vertical stack will land you at the same vertical
index.

options.name: touch
options.desciption: Enable touch navigation on devices with touch input

options.name: keyboard
options.desciption: Enable keyboard shortcuts for navigation

options.name: mouse-wheel
options.desciption: Enable slide navigation via mouse wheel

options.name: hide-inactive-cursor
options.desciption: Hide cursor if inactive

options.name: hide-cursor-time
options.desciption: Time before the cursor is hidden (in ms)

options.name: loop
options.desciption: Loop the presentation

options.name: shuffle
options.desciption: Randomize the order of slides each time the presentation loads

options.name: controls
options.desciption:
Show arrow controls for navigating through slides (defaults to
auto, which will show controls when vertical slides are present
or when the deck is embedded in an iframe).

options.name: controls-layout
options.desciption: Location for navigation controls (`edges` or `bottom-right`)

options.name: controls-tutorial
options.desciption: Help the user learn the controls by providing visual hints.

options.name: controls-back-arrows
options.desciption:
Visibility rule for backwards navigation arrows; `faded`, `hidden`
or `visible`

options.name: auto-slide
options.desciption: Automatically progress all slides at the specified interval

options.name: auto-slide-stoppable
options.desciption: Stop auto-sliding after user input

options.name: auto-slide-method
options.desciption: Navigation method to use when auto sliding (defaults to navigateNext)

options.name: default-timing
options.desciption: Expected average seconds per slide (used by pacing timer in speaker view)

options.name: pause
options.desciption: Flags whether it should be possible to pause the presentation (blackout)

options.name: help
options.desciption: Show a help overlay when the `?` key is pressed

options.name: hash
options.desciption: Add the current slide to the URL hash

options.name: hash-type
options.desciption: URL hash type (`number` or `title`)

options.name: hash-one-based-index
options.desciption: Use 1 based indexing for hash links to match slide number

options.name: respond-to-hash-changes
options.desciption: Monitor the hash and change slides accordingly

options.name: fragment-in-url
options.desciption: Include the current fragment in the URL

options.name: slide-tone
options.desciption: Play a subtle sound when changing slides

options.name: pdf-separate-fragments
options.desciption: Prints each fragment on a separate slide

options.name: pdf-page-height-offset
options.desciption:
Offset used to reduce the height of content within exported PDF pages.
This exists to account for environment differences based on how you
print to PDF. CLI printing options, like phantomjs and wkpdf, can end
on precisely the total height of the document whereas in-browser
printing has to end one pixel before.

options.name: preview-links
options.desciption:
Opens links in an iframe preview overlay (defaults to
auto, which will use an iframe in fullscreen mode).

options.name: auto-play-media
options.desciption:
Autoplay embedded media. Default is `null` (only when `autoplay` 
attribute is specified)

options.name: preload-iframes
options.desciption:
Global override for preloading lazy-loaded iframes

- `null`:   Iframes with data-src AND data-preload will be loaded when within
  the `viewDistanc`e, iframes with only data-src will be loaded when visible
- `true`:   All iframes with data-src will be loaded when within the viewDistance
- `false`:  All iframes with data-src will be loaded only when visible

options.name: view-distance
options.desciption: Number of slides away from the current slide to pre-load resources for

options.name: mobile-view-distance
options.desciption: Number of slides away from the current slide to pre-load resources for (on mobile devices).

options.name: parallax-background-image
options.desciption: Parallax background image

options.name: parallax-background-size
options.desciption: Parallax background size (e.g. '2100px 900px')

options.name: parallax-background-horizontal
options.desciption: Number of pixels to move the parallax background horizontally per slide.

options.name: parallax-background-vertical
options.desciption: Number of pixels to move the parallax background vertically per slide.

options.name: auto-stretch
options.desciption: For slides with a single top-level image, automatically stretch it to fill the slide.

options.name: width
options.desciption:
The "normal" width of the presentation, aspect ratio will
be preserved when the presentation is scaled to fit different
resolutions. Can be specified using percentage units.

options.name: height
options.desciption:
The "normal" height of the presentation, aspect ratio will
be preserved when the presentation is scaled to fit different
resolutions. Can be specified using percentage units.

options.name: margin
options.desciption: Factor of the display size that should remain empty around the content

options.name: min-scale
options.desciption: Bounds for smallest possible scale to apply to content

options.name: max-scale
options.desciption: Bounds for largest possible scale to apply to content

options.name: center
options.desciption: Vertical centering of slides

options.name: disable-layout
options.desciption: Disables the default reveal.js slide layout (scaling and centering)

options.name: mainfont
options.desciption:
For HTML output, sets the CSS `font-family` on the HTML element.

For LaTeX output, the main font family for use with `xelatex` or 
`lualatex`. Takes the name of any system font, using the
[`fontspec`](https://ctan.org/pkg/fontspec) package. 

For ConTeXt output, the main font family. Use the name of any 
system font. See [ConTeXt Fonts](https://wiki.contextgarden.net/Fonts) for more
information.

options.name: monofont
options.desciption:
For HTML output, sets the CSS font-family property on code elements.

For PowerPoint output, sets the font used for code.

For LaTeX output, the monospace font family for use with `xelatex` or 
`lualatex`: take the name of any system font, using the
[`fontspec`](https://ctan.org/pkg/fontspec) package.  

For ConTeXt output, the monspace font family. Use the name of any 
system font. See [ConTeXt Fonts](https://wiki.contextgarden.net/Fonts) for more
information.

options.name: fontsize
options.desciption:
For HTML output, sets the base CSS `font-size` property.

For LaTeX and ConTeXt output, sets the font size for the document body text.

options.name: linestretch
options.desciption:
For HTML output sets the CSS `line-height` property on the html 
element, which is preferred to be unitless.

For LaTeX output, adjusts line spacing using the 
[setspace](https://ctan.org/pkg/setspace) package, e.g. 1.25, 1.5.

options.name: fontcolor
options.desciption: Sets the CSS `color` property.

options.name: linkcolor
options.desciption:
For HTML output, sets the CSS `color` property on all links.

For LaTeX output, The color used for internal links using color options
allowed by [`xcolor`](https://ctan.org/pkg/xcolor), 
including the `dvipsnames`, `svgnames`, and
`x11names` lists.

For ConTeXt output, sets the color for both external links and links within the document.

options.name: monobackgroundcolor
options.desciption: Sets the CSS `background-color` property on code elements and adds extra padding.

options.name: backgroundcolor
options.desciption: Sets the CSS `background-color` property on the html element.

options.name: classoption
options.desciption:
For LaTeX/PDF output, the options set for the document
class.

For HTML output using KaTeX, you can render display
math equations flush left using `classoption: fleqn`

options.name: max-width
options.desciption: Adds a css `max-width` to the body Element.

options.name: margin-left
options.desciption:
For HTML output, sets the `margin-left` property on the Body element.

For LaTeX output, sets the left margin if `geometry` is not 
used (otherwise `geometry` overrides this value)

For ConTeXt output, sets the left margin if `layout` is not used, 
otherwise `layout` overrides these.

For `wkhtmltopdf` sets the left page margin.

options.name: margin-right
options.desciption:
For HTML output, sets the `margin-right` property on the Body element.

For LaTeX output, sets the right margin if `geometry` is not 
used (otherwise `geometry` overrides this value)

For ConTeXt output, sets the right margin if `layout` is not used, 
otherwise `layout` overrides these.

For `wkhtmltopdf` sets the right page margin.

options.name: margin-top
options.desciption:
For HTML output, sets the `margin-top` property on the Body element.

For LaTeX output, sets the top margin if `geometry` is not 
used (otherwise `geometry` overrides this value)

For ConTeXt output, sets the top margin if `layout` is not used, 
otherwise `layout` overrides these.

For `wkhtmltopdf` sets the top page margin.

options.name: margin-bottom
options.desciption:
For HTML output, sets the `margin-bottom` property on the Body element.

For LaTeX output, sets the bottom margin if `geometry` is not 
used (otherwise `geometry` overrides this value)

For ConTeXt output, sets the bottom margin if `layout` is not used, 
otherwise `layout` overrides these.

For `wkhtmltopdf` sets the bottom page margin.

options.name: cap-location
options.desciption: Where to place figure and table captions.

options.name: fig-cap-location
options.desciption: Where to place figure captions.

options.name: tbl-cap-location
options.desciption: Where to place table captions.

options.name: code-copy
options.desciption: Enables a code copy icon for code blocks.

options.name: code-link
options.desciption:
Enables hyper-linking of functions within code blocks 
to their online documentation.

Code linking is currently implemented only for the knitr engine 
(via the [downlit](https://downlit.r-lib.org/) package).

options.name: code-tools
options.desciption:
Include a code tools menu (for hiding and showing code).
Use `true` or `false` to enable or disable the standard code 
tools menu. Specify sub-properties `source`, `toggle`, and
`caption` to customize the behavior and appearnce of code tools.

options.name: highlight-style
options.desciption:
Specifies the coloring style to be used in highlighted source code.

Instead of a *STYLE* name, a JSON file with extension
` .theme` may be supplied.  This will be parsed as a KDE
syntax highlighting theme and (if valid) used as the
highlighting style.

options.name: syntax-definitions
options.desciption: KDE language syntax definition files (XML)

options.name: indented-code-classes
options.desciption: Specify classes to use for all indented code blocks

options.name: code-fold
options.desciption:
Collapse code into an HTML `<details>` tag so the user can display it on-demand.
Specify `show` to have the code initiallly visible.

options.name: code-summary
options.desciption: Summary text to use for code blocks collapsed using `code-fold`

options.name: code-overflow
options.desciption: Choose whether to `scroll` or `wrap` when code lines are too wide for their container.

options.name: code-line-numbers
options.desciption: Include line numbers in code block output.

options.name: engine
options.desciption: Engine used for executable code blocks.

options.name: jupyter
options.desciption: Configures the Jupyter engine.

options.name: knitr
options.desciption: Set Knitr options.

options.name: cache
options.desciption:
Cache results of computations (using the [knitr cache](https://yihui.org/knitr/demo/cache/) 
for R documents, and [Jupyter Cache](https://jupyter-cache.readthedocs.io/en/latest/) 
for Jupyter documents).

Note that cache invalidation is triggered by changes in chunk source code 
(or other cache attributes you've defined). Use `refresh` to force a refresh
of the cache even if has not been otherwise invalidated.

options.name: freeze
options.desciption:
Option to denote that computational documents should never be re-rendered during
a global project render (`freeze: true`), or alternatively only be re-rendered
when their source file changes (`freeze: auto`).

options.name: server
options.desciption: Document server

options.name: daemon
options.desciption:
Run Jupyter kernels within a peristent daemon (to mitigate kernel startup time).
By default a daemon with a timeout of 300 seconds will be used. Set `daemon`
to another timeout value or to `false` to disable it altogether.

options.name: debug
options.desciption: Show code-execution related debug information.

options.name: eval
options.desciption: Evaluate code cells (if `false` just echos the code into output).

options.name: echo
options.desciption: Include cell source code in rendered output.

options.name: output
options.desciption: Include the results of executing the code in the output (specify `asis` to treat output as raw markdown with no enclosing containers).

options.name: warning
options.desciption: Including warnings in rendered output.

options.name: error
options.desciption:
Include errors in the output (note that this implies that errors executing code
will not halt processing of the document).

options.name: include
options.desciption: Catch all for preventing any output (code or results) from being included in output.

options.name: fig-align
options.desciption: Default horizontal alignment for figures

options.name: fig-width
options.desciption: Default width for figures generated by Matplotlib or R graphics

options.name: fig-height
options.desciption: Default height for figures generated by Matplotlib or R graphics

options.name: fig-format
options.desciption: Default format for figures generated by Matplotlib or R graphics

options.name: fig-dpi
options.desciption: Default DPI for figures generated by Matplotlib or R graphics

options.name: fig-responsive
options.desciption: Whether to make images in this document responsive.

options.name: link-external-icon
options.desciption: Show a special icon next to links that leave the current site.

options.name: link-external-icon
options.desciption: Show a special icon next to links that leave the current site.

options.name: link-external-newwindow
options.desciption: Open external links in a new browser window or tab (rather than navigating the current tab).

options.name: link-external-filter
options.desciption:
A regular expression that can be used to determine whether a link is an internal link. For example, 
the following will treat links that start with http://www.quarto.org as internal links (and others
will be considered external):

```
^(?:http:|https:)\/\/www\.quarto\.org\/custom
```

options.name: bibliography
options.desciption: Document bibliography (BibTeX or CSL). May be a single file or a list of files

options.name: csl
options.desciption: Citation Style Language file to use for formatting references.

options.name: citeproc
options.desciption:
Turn on built-in citation processing. To use this feature, you will need
to have a document containing citations and a source of bibliographic data: 
either an external bibliography file or a list of `references` in the 
document's YAML metadata. You can optionally also include a `csl` 
citation style file.

options.name: citation-abbreviations
reference-location
options.desciption:
Specify whether footnotes (and references, if `reference-links` is
set) are placed at the end of the current (top-level) block, the
current section, the margin, or the end of the document.

options.name: header-includes
options.desciption: The markdown to include at the end of the document header.

options.name: include-before
options.desciption: The markdown to include at the beginning of the document body (e.g. after the `<body>` tag in HTML, or the `\begin{document}` command in LaTeX).

options.name: include-after
options.desciption: The markdown to include at the end of the document body (before the `</body>` tag in HTML, or the `\end{document}` command in LaTeX).

options.name: include-before-body
options.desciption:
Include contents of files, verbatim, at the beginning of the document body
(e.g. after the `<body>` tag in HTML, or the `\begin{document}` command 
in LaTeX).

options.name: include-after-body
options.desciption:
Include contents of files, verbatim, at the end of the document body (before
the `</body>` tag in HTML, or the `\end{document}` command in LaTeX).

options.name: include-in-header
options.desciption:
Include contents of files, verbatim, at the end of the header. This can
be used, for example, to include special CSS or JavaScript in HTML 
documents.

options.name: resources
options.desciption: Path (or glob) to files to publish with this document.

options.name: metadata-files
options.desciption:
Read metadata from the supplied YAML (or JSON) files. This
option can be used with every input format, but string scalars
in the YAML file will always be parsed as Markdown. Generally,
the input will be handled the same as in YAML metadata blocks.
Values in files specified later in the list will be preferred
over those specified earlier. Metadata values specified inside 
the document, or by using `-M`, overwrite values specified with
this option.

options.name: from
options.desciption: Format to read from. Extensions can be individually enabled or disabled by appending +EXTENSION or -EXTENSION to the format name (e.g. markdown+emoji).

options.name: output-file
options.desciption: Output file to write to

options.name: output-ext
options.desciption: Extension to use for generated output file

options.name: template
options.desciption: Use the specified file as a custom template for the generated document.

options.name: standalone
options.desciption: Produce output with an appropriate header and footer (e.g. a standalone HTML, LaTeX, TEI, or RTF file, not a fragment)

options.name: self-contained
options.desciption:
Produce a standalone HTML file with no external dependencies, using
`data:` URIs to incorporate the contents of linked scripts, stylesheets,
images, and videos. The resulting file should be
"self-contained," in the sense that it needs no external files and no net
access to be displayed properly by a browser. This option works only with
HTML output formats, including `html4`, `html5`, `html+lhs`, `html5+lhs`,
`s5`, `slidy`, `slideous`, `dzslides`, and `revealjs`. Scripts, images,
and stylesheets at absolute URLs will be downloaded; those at relative
URLs will be sought relative to the working directory (if the first source
file is local) or relative to the base URL (if the first source
file is remote).  Elements with the attribute
`data-external="1"` will be left alone; the documents they
link to will not be incorporated in the document.

options.name: self-contained-math
options.desciption:
Embed math libraries (e.g. MathJax) within `self-contained` output.
Note that math libraries are not embedded by default because they are 
quite large and often time consuming to download.

options.name: filters
options.desciption:
Specify executables or Lua scripts to be used as a filter transforming
the pandoc AST after the input is parsed and before the output is written.

options.name: keep-md
options.desciption: Keep the markdown file generated by executing code

options.name: keep-ipynb
options.desciption: Keep the notebook file generated from executing code.

options.name: extract-media
options.desciption:
Extract images and other media contained in or linked from the source document to the
path DIR, creating it if necessary, and adjust the images references in the document
so they point to the extracted files. Media are downloaded, read from the file
system, or extracted from a binary container (e.g. docx), as needed. The original
file paths are used if they are relative paths not containing ... Otherwise filenames
are constructed from the SHA1 hash of the contents.

options.name: resource-path
options.desciption:
List of paths to search for images and other resources. The paths should
be separated by : on Linux, UNIX, and macOS systems, and by ; on Windows.

options.name: default-image-extension
options.desciption:
Specify a default extension to use when image paths/URLs have no
extension.  This allows you to use the same source for formats that
require different kinds of images.  Currently this option only affects
the Markdown and LaTeX readers.

options.name: abbreviations
options.desciption:
Specifies a custom abbreviations file, with abbreviations one to a line.
This list is used when reading Markdown input: strings found in this list
will be followed by a nonbreaking space, and the period will not produce sentence-ending space in formats like LaTeX.  The strings may not contain
spaces.

options.name: dpi
options.desciption:
Specify the default dpi (dots per inch) value for conversion from pixels to inch/
centimeters and vice versa. (Technically, the correct term would be ppi: pixels per
inch.) The default is `96`. When images contain information about dpi internally, the
encoded value is used instead of the default specified by this option.

options.name: tab-stop
options.desciption:
Specify the number of spaces per tab (default is 4). Note that tabs
within normal textual input are always converted to spaces. Tabs 
within code are also converted, however this can be disabled with
`preserve-tabs: false`.

options.name: preserve-tabs
options.desciption:
Preserve tabs within code instead of converting them to spaces.
(By default, pandoc converts tabs to spaces before parsing its input.) 
Note that this will only affect tabs in literal code spans and code blocks. 
Tabs in regular text are always treated as spaces.

options.name: eol
options.desciption:
Manually specify line endings: `crlf` (Windows), `lf`
(macOS/Linux/UNIX), or `native` (line endings appropriate
to the OS on which pandoc is being run).  The default is
`native`.

options.name: strip-comments
options.desciption:
Strip out HTML comments in the Markdown source,
rather than passing them on to Markdown, Textile or HTML
output as raw HTML.  This does not apply to HTML comments
inside raw HTML blocks when the `markdown_in_html_blocks`
extension is not set.

options.name: ascii
options.desciption:
Use only ASCII characters in output. Currently supported for XML
and HTML formats (which use entities instead of UTF-8 when this
option is selected), CommonMark, gfm, and Markdown (which use
entities), roff ms (which use hexadecimal escapes), and to a
limited degree LaTeX (which uses standard commands for accented
characters when possible). roff man output uses ASCII by default.

options.name: reveal-js-url
options.desciption: Directory containing reveal.js files.

options.name: trace
options.desciption: Display trace debug output.

options.name: fail-if-warnings
options.desciption: Exit with error status if there are any warnings.
